paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a heterozygous mutation in the TTR gene (p.G103R) associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis in a Han Chinese family, detailing penetrance data and individual cases.

patients.demographics: 48-year-old female proband, 26-year-old female daughter, and fourth sister (age not specified)
patients.phenotype: Proband and fourth sister had low vision; daughter was an asymptomatic carrier.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was a 48-year-old woman who had progressive visual impairment in both eyes for 12 years.
The clinical phenotype of her daughter (26 years old) was normal, while the proband and her fourth sister had low vision.
The proband and her fourth sister had low vision.

functional_data.summary: The mutation has been reported to be pathogenic and related to ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of the p.G103R mutation associated with vitreous hemorrhage in China.
key_quotes: This mutation has been reported to be pathogenic and related to ATTRv amyloidosis.
To our knowledge, this is the first case of ATTRv amyloidosis caused by a p.G103R mutation of the TTR gene associated with vitreous hemorrhage in China.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
